name: Fio banka
description: A Czech bank known for offering 'transparent accounts' where transaction history is publicly viewable. Note: This recommendation comes from unverified user reports on X/Twitter and has not been vetted for robust free-speech policies.

name: Old Glory Bank
description: A customized banking solution explicitly founded to uphold constitutional rights and oppose debanking based on political views.

name: None identified (Cooperative Bank)
description: No specific cooperative bank with a verified free-speech charter identified.

name: None identified (Savings Bank)
description: No specific savings bank with a verified free-speech charter identified.

name: None identified (Regional Bank)
description: No specific regional bank with a verified free-speech charter identified.

name: None identified (Mortgage Bank)
description: No specific mortgage bank with a verified free-speech charter identified.

name: None identified (Building Society)
description: No specific building society with a verified free-speech charter identified.

name: None identified (Private Bank)
description: No private bank identified; private banks (like Coutts) have historically been high-risk for debanking PEPs.

name: None identified (Ethical Bank)
description: Most 'Ethical Banks' (like GLS) align with progressive causes and have explicitly debanked right-wing entities.

name: Coign
description: A credit card issuer built for conservatives, offering cash back rewards that support conservative charities.

name: Monerium
description: An authorized Electronic Money Institution (EMI) that issues regulated digital Euros (EURe) on the blockchain. It provides a personal IBAN, allowing users to bridge fiat directly to a self-custodial wallet, minimizing the risk of funds being frozen in a centralized app.

name: Mercury (US Only)
description: Focused on startups. Not explicitly 'free speech', but generally more agnostic than major traditional banks. (Still subject to US regulations).

name: None identified (Sustainable)
description: Sustainable banks generally align with ESG metrics that flag right-wing actors as risks.

name: AMINA Bank
description: A fully licensed Swiss crypto bank (formerly SEBA Bank) bridging digital and traditional assets. Offers a regulated environment for holding crypto and fiat.

name: GabPay
description: A payment processing platform built by Gab.com specifically to offer an alternative to PayPal and Stripe for banned users.

name: Parallel Economy
description: A payment gateway backed by Dan Bongino, designed to be censorship-resistant for businesses.

name: AlignPay
description: Payment processing solution built to stop cancel culture and debanking.

name: BTCPay Server
description: A self-hosted, open-source cryptocurrency payment processor. It eliminates third-party intermediaries, making it impossible to be debanked.

name: None identified (Direct Debit)
description: Direct debit is deeply integrated into the legacy banking system; no independent 'free speech' layer exists.

name: Strike
description: Uses the Bitcoin Lightning Network for instant global remittance, bypassing Swift/SEPA messaging controls.

name: Bisq
description: A decentralized peer-to-peer bitcoin exchange. No central server, no KYC, and no ability for a company to ban users.

name: Hodl Hodl
description: A non-custodial P2P Bitcoin trading platform that does not hold funds.

name: ThorChain
description: Decentralized liquidity protocol allowing native swapping of assets (like BTC to ETH) without a centralized exchange.

name: Samourai Wallet / Sparrow Wallet
description: Self-custody wallets focusing on privacy and coin control, ensuring funds cannot be frozen by third parties.

name: Coincards
description: Allows purchase of gift cards and prepaid cards using cryptocurrency, bypassing direct bank debanking.

name: Interactive Brokers
description: While a large institution, IBKR is known for its professional/neutral stance compared to retail apps like Robinhood, though not explicitly anti-debanking.

name: GiveSendGo
description: The primary alternative to GoFundMe. Explicitly allows campaigns banned on other platforms (e.g., Freedom Convoy, Rittenhouse).

name: 4fund
description: A crowdfunding platform (zrzutka.pl) offering fewer restrictions than US-based alternatives. Note: This recommendation comes from unverified user reports on X/Twitter and has not been vetted for robust free-speech policies.

name: SubscribeStar
description: Membership platform serving as an alternative to Patreon. Hosts many creators who have been deplatformed elsewhere.

name: Locals
description: A community platform (merged with Rumble) allowing creators to publish content and receive subscription support independent of Big Tech.

name: Tallycoin
description: A crowdfunding platform built on the Bitcoin blockchain. No middlemen to freeze funds.

name: None identified (Lending)
description: No 'anti-woke' or free-speech specific lending fintechs identified.
